weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Initial week focusing on establishing foundational endurance and introducing basic technique work for swimming and running. The primary objective is to create a consistent training rhythm, develop aerobic base, and introduce fundamental movement patterns specific to both sports.

intervals.drill_description: Technique drill: Focus on early vertical forearm and efficient stroke mechanics

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Week 2 continues the foundational building phase, focusing on developing aerobic endurance and establishing consistent training patterns in both swimming and running. This week will introduce slightly more structured intervals and begin to build the athlete's base fitness with controlled, progressive workload.

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Week 4 continues the base-building phase with a focus on consolidating aerobic endurance and introducing moderate intensity work in both swimming and running. This week aims to progressively challenge the athlete's aerobic system while maintaining technique and preventing overtraining.

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Week 5 marks a transition point in the training plan, shifting from base building to more structured intensity work. This week introduces more targeted interval training and technique refinement for both swimming and running, with a focus on developing aerobic capacity and improving sport-specific skills.

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Week 6 focuses on consolidating the base endurance built in previous weeks while introducing more structured intensity work. This week aims to challenge the athlete's aerobic capacity through a mix of swimming and running sessions with increasing technical complexity and sustained effort levels.

intervals.drill_description: Focus on maintaining upright posture, midfoot strike, and controlled arm swing
Progressive increase in pace, emphasizing form maintenance

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Week 7 focuses on building intensity and introducing more challenging interval work to enhance the athlete's aerobic capacity and race-specific endurance. This week marks a transition from base building to more targeted performance development, with increased focus on threshold-level efforts in both swimming and running.

Bilateral breathing drill, alternate sides every 25m

workouts.name: Advanced Endurance Swimming: Technique and Capacity Integration

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Week 8 focuses on consolidating the endurance gains from previous weeks while introducing more race-specific intensity and technique refinement. This week aims to push the athlete's aerobic capacity and efficiency in both swimming and running, with a careful balance of high-intensity intervals and technical skill development.

workouts.name: Threshold Swimming Session - Sustained Aerobic Power

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Week 9 focuses on consolidating endurance gains and introducing more race-specific intensity. This week aims to push the athlete's aerobic threshold in both swimming and running, with a mix of longer sustained efforts and targeted interval work. The plan continues to build on the progressive overload principle, incrementally increasing workout complexity and intensity.

intervals.drill_description: Catch and pull technique focus, alternate between normal and exaggerated catch
Focus on maintaining proper high elbow catch and pull phase technique

workouts.name: Peak Performance Swim Session - Race Pace Integration

intervals.drill_description: Pull drill with focus on upper body engagement

weekly_workouts.weekly_workout_description: Final week of the 10-week endurance training plan, focusing on consolidating fitness gains, maintaining peak performance, and preparing for potential race-level efforts. This week will feature high-intensity sessions in both swimming and running, with a strategic approach to volume and recovery.

plan_description: A comprehensive 10-week endurance-focused multi-sport training plan targeting swimming and running, designed for an intermediate athlete. The plan aims to progressively build aerobic capacity, technique, and endurance across both swimming and running disciplines.
progression_strategy: The plan will follow a systematic progression of increasing volume and intensity. The first 4 weeks will focus on establishing a solid base, with gradual increases in training volume. Weeks 5-8 will introduce more intense interval work and technique-focused sessions. The final 2 weeks will peak the athlete's endurance and prepare for potential race-level performance.
